intro: Buphthalmum stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ox-eye, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Buphthalmum stenophyllum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
